body:
cmd.exe has several issues with multi-line commands:
1. `cmd /C` only executes the first line of a multi-line command
2. For loop variables need `%%i` in batch files but `%i` interactively
3. `echo content >` includes trailing space before redirect - need `echo content>`
4. Same trailing space issue with pipes: `echo hello |` vs `echo hello|`

PowerShell is cleaner:
- `powershell -Command` handles multi-line commands directly (like bash -c)
- Consistent $variable syntax in scripts and interactive
- No trailing space issues
- Can use: `powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command $command`

Decision: Default to PowerShell on Windows, bash on Unix. Add %shell directive for override.
title: Windows shell execution: PowerShell vs cmd.exe
